top_categories.workout_context: Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego’s technical rocky single-track alternating with sandy washes — sharp rocks destroy tires demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.

Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego’s technical rocky single-track alternating with sandy washes — sharp rocks destroy tires and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
At 131 miles, Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego’s 12,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego. Make this intensity feel like home.

Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on technical rocky single-track alternating with sandy washes — sharp rocks destroy tires.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego’s 12,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.

Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego’s technical rocky single-track alternating with sandy washes — sharp rocks destroy tires delivers on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego’s 131 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride technical rocky single-track alternating with sandy washes — sharp rocks destroy tires at race-day cadence weekly. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 131 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and VO2max to prepare you for 131 miles of technical rocky single-track alternating with sandy washes — sharp rocks destroy tires in Del Mar, California.
